item.title: Evaluation of watermelons texture using their vibration responses
item.description: Rouzbeh Abbaszadeh, Ali Rajabipour, Mohammad Mahjoob, Mojtaba Delshad, Hojjat Ahmadi “Evaluation of watermelons texture using their vibration responses” (2013) // Biosystems Engineering. Publisher: Elsevier BV. Vol. 115. No 1. Pp. 102–105. DOI: 10.1016/j.biosystemseng.2013.01.001 Bib @Article{abbaszadeh2013, title = {Evaluation of watermelons texture using their vibration responses}, volume = {115}, issn = {1537-5110}, url = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.biosystemseng.2013.01.001}, doi = {10.1016/j.biosystemseng.2013.01.001}, number = {1}, journal = {Biosystems Engineering}, publisher = {Elsevier BV}, author = {Abbaszadeh, Rouzbeh and Rajabipour, Ali and Mahjoob, Mohammad and Delshad, Mojtaba and Ahmadi, Hojjat}, year = {2013}, month = {may}, pages = {102–105} } Notes Fabulous research! Four scientists took 43 watermelons (Crimson sweet), measured their vibration response, rated them using a five-point ripeness scale, built a regression model to predict ripeness from vibration response, checked the model on the same 43 watermelons, got R² = 0.9998, published the results in a peer-reviewed journal. Debunked in [Statistics Done Wrong: The Woefully Complete Guide].
